meanings.definition: A person or thing that skeletonizes.
meanings.sent1: The skeletonizers carefully removed all the flesh from the bones.
meanings.sent2: The museum had advanced skeletonizers that could clean skeletons quickly.
meanings.sent3: The skeletonizers at the Halloween party were so good, they made the decorations look real!
meanings.sent4: Her sharp eyes were like skeletonizers, stripping away all pretense to reveal the truth.
meanings.sent5: The forensic scientist used special skeletonizers to analyze the remains.

meanings.definition: A machine or tool that skeletonizes.
meanings.sent1: The old skeletonizers in the lab were still functional after many years.
meanings.sent2: The new skeletonizers in the factory increased efficiency by removing excess material.
meanings.sent3: The skeletonizers in the workshop hummed as they worked, like a chorus of tiny robots.
meanings.sent4: The laser cutter was a precision skeletonizer, carving intricate designs effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The skeletonizers in the textile industry helped streamline the production process.

meanings.sent1: The skeletonizers of the leaves in autumn create a beautiful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The skeletonizers of the fish revealed intricate details of their skeletal structure.
meanings.sent3: The skeletonizers of the cake left behind a delicious crumbly mess.
meanings.sent4: The skeletonizers of time gradually wore away the once grand statue.
meanings.sent5: The skeletonizers of erosion shaped the landscape over centuries.
